name: My Crappe Car
description:
A game made for the Global Game Jam 2018, this time with the theme of "Transmission". Your car transmission's about to fail and you need to get the car to the mechanic's. You're not gonna pay to have it towed again, are you?!

Original GGJ page: https://globalgamejam.org/2018/games/my-crappe-car

This silly game prototype was made in 48 hours with (nearly) completely new art assets made from scratch for the jam.

Made by:

David Newel - Design and art

Jim Niehues - Programming

Adam Dayton - Additional Level Design

Garrett McPherson - Music

To play:

The game operates entirely on the mouse. Click and hold on the foot pedals for brake and for gas, and use the knock-off cell phone to inevitably call for a tow. Don't hit bumps too hard, or you'll start to lose vital parts in your car. There's currently no way to put the car in reverse in the game, but we'll just blame that on  your transmission problems for now...

Get your car to the mechanic shop to "win" (i.e. not pay the towing fee).
